name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/ConsoleReporter.ts
ConsoleReporter
description:
Uses [standard output](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_streams)
 to report on progress of your Serenity/JS acceptance tests.

 `ConsoleReporter` ships with colour themes for both dark and light terminals,
 as well as a monochromatic theme for those moments when you're in a noir mood
 (or have a terminal that doesn't support colours, like the good old `cmd.exe` on Windows).
examples:
<caption>Registering the reporter programmatically</caption>
import { serenity } form '@serenity-js/core';
import { ConsoleReporter } form '@serenity-js/console-reporter';

serenity.configure({
    crew: [ ConsoleReporter.withDefaultColourSupport() ],
});

<caption>Registering the reporter using Protractor configuration</caption>
// protractor.conf.js
const { ConsoleReporter } = require('@serenity-js/console-reporter');

exports.config = {
  framework:     'custom',
  frameworkPath: require.resolve('@serenity-js/protractor/adapter'),

  serenity: {
    crew: [
      ConsoleReporter.withDefaultColourSupport(),
    ],
    // other Serenity/JS config
  },

  // other Protractor config
};

name: withDefaultColourSupport
description:
Instantiates a `ConsoleReporter` that auto-detects
 your terminal's support for colours and use a colour theme
 for dark terminals if successful.

 Please note that spawning your test process from another process
 (by using [npm-failsafe](https://www.npmjs.com/package/npm-failsafe), for example)
 causes the `ConsoleReporter` to use the monochromatic colour scheme,
 as colour support can't be detected in child processes.

 If the above describes your setup, use {@link ConsoleReporter#forDarkTerminals}
 or {@link ConsoleReporter#forLightTerminals} to make the sub-process produce colour output.

name: forMonochromaticTerminals
description:
Instantiates a `ConsoleReporter` with a monochromatic colour theme.
 Good for terminals with no colour support (like the `cmd.exe` on Windows),
 or for when you need to pipe the output to a text file and want
 to avoid printing control characters.

name: forDarkTerminals
description: Instantiates a `ConsoleReporter` with a colour theme optimised for terminals with dark backgrounds.

name: forLightTerminals
description: Instantiates a `ConsoleReporter` with a colour theme optimised for terminals with light backgrounds.

name: assignedTo
description:
Creates a new instance of this {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/stage~StageCrewMember}
 and assigns it to a given {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/stage~Stage}.

params.name: stage
params.description: An instance of a {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/stage~Stage} this {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/stage~StageCrewMember} will be assigned to

name: notifyOf
description: Handles {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/events~DomainEvent} objects emitted by the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/stage~StageCrewMember}.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/Printer.ts
Printer
description:
A simple abstraction around the standard output stream
 with support for indenting the printed text.

name: println
description:
Prints the `args` to the `stdout`, followed by a new line character (`\n`).

 Please note that this method bypasses any indentation as it's intended
 to be used to print separator lines, etc.

name: print
description:
Prints the `args` to the `stdout`, indenting the output according to
 the current indentation level.

name: indent
description: Increases the current indentation by 2 spaces.

name: outdent
description: Reduces the current indentation by 2 spaces.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/Summary.ts
src/stage/crew/console-reporter/SummaryFormatter.ts
src/stage/crew/console-reporter/themes/TerminalTheme.ts
TerminalTheme
description:
Decorates text with control characters to make the terminal
 print output in colour.

name: joined
description: Converts the `parts` to `string` and joins them together.

name: repeat
description:
Repeats a given `pattern` so that it takes up to `maxLength` characters.
 Used to produce separator lines.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/themes/ThemeForColourTerminals.ts
ThemeForColourTerminals
description:
Base class for {@link TerminalTheme} implementations intended
 to print to terminals that support colour output.

name: outcome
description:
Joins the `parts` into a single string and decorates it
 using a colour appropriate for a given {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/model~Outcome}.

params.name: outcome
params.description:
an instance of an {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/model~Outcome}
 or a string class name of one of its implementations.

params.name: parts
params.description: the parts of the message to be decorated

name: diff
description:
Turns the serialised `expectedValue` and `actualValue` into
 a visual diff, so that it's easier for the developer to spot
 the difference between the two values.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/themes/ThemeForDarkTerminals.ts
ThemeForDarkTerminals
description: A simple colour theme for terminals with dark backgrounds.

name: heading
description: Formats the heading

params.name: parts
params.description: `parts` to be converted to string, joined together, and formatted as a heading

name: separator
description: Decorates the heading with theme colours.

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern to be repeated to create a separator, for example `-`, ` - - `, etc.

name: log
description: Decorates the log entries that the developer wanted to have captured in the output.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/themes/ThemeForLightTerminals.ts
ThemeForLightTerminals
description: A simple colour theme for terminals with light backgrounds.

name: heading
description: Decorates the heading with theme colours.

params.name: parts
params.description: `parts` to be converted to string, joined together, and formatted as a heading

name: separator
description: Decorates the heading with theme colours.

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern to be repeated to create a separator, for example `-`, ` - - `, etc.

name: log
description: Decorates the log entries that the developer wanted to have captured in the output.

name: src/stage/crew/console-reporter/themes/ThemeForMonochromaticTerminals.ts
ThemeForMonochromaticTerminals
description: A simple colour theme for terminals with no colour support.

name: heading
description: Formats the heading

params.name: parts
params.description: `parts` to be converted to string, joined together, and formatted as a heading

name: outcome
description:
Joins the `parts` into a single string.
 Since this class represents a theme for monochromatic terminals,
 no decoration of the text is performed.

params.name: outcome
params.description:
an instance of an {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/model~Outcome}
 or a string class name of one of its implementations.

name: separator
description: Decorates the heading with theme colours.

params.name: pattern
params.description: The pattern to be repeated to create a separator, for example `-`, ` - - `, etc.

name: diff
description:
Turns the serialised `expectedValue` and `actualValue` into
 a visual diff, so that it's easier for the developer to spot
 the difference between the two values.

name: log
description: Decorates the log entries that the developer wanted to have captured in the output.

name: it10
